interest_reason: The precision of querying and the elegance of dimensional modeling - how we structure data shapes how we think about problems
Automation and reproducibility - building systems that run themselves while maintaining transparency
Translating complex business logic into defensible metrics - the gap between what people ask for and what they actually need
Understanding systems by finding their weak points - protection through structured skepticism
Creating guardrails that enable rather than constrain - governance as a service not a blocker
Seeing how changes ripple across business data application and infrastructure - coherent change at scale
Separating signal from noise - what changed and why should we care
Making sense of unstructured human communication at scale - what are people actually saying
Finding the best possible outcome within real-world limits - trade-offs made explicit
Translating between technical and executive contexts - making complexity accessible without oversimplifying
Transformation as code - making analytics reproducible and testable
Isolation and portability - how boundaries enable both security and flexibility
Making uncertainty tangible through scenarios - what could go wrong and how bad could it get
Verifying that protections work as intended - trust through evidence not assertion
Distilling technical complexity into decision-ready insights - what matters and why
Growing capability in others on project teams - coaching through doing
Exploring intelligent automation - where should machines assist and where should humans decide
Long-term thinking about systems impact - who benefits who pays what persists
